intro: Tapiphyllum laetum, commonly known as the cheerful tapiphyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically bright yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture. Tapiphyllum laetum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
